You walk out onto the mansion's front lawn.

sceneList.name: The Kitchen

exits.text: to the south leading to the billiard room

intro.text: You enter a large kitchen. Black and white tiles checker across the floor to a long island in the center of the room.

exits.text: to the west into another room
to the east onto a balcony

intro.text:
You step up on to the ottoman and jump to reach the first intact stair. You pull yourself up onto your torso and just barely manage to heave the rest of your body over the ledge.

The rest of the stairs are sturdy enough and you make your way up to the second floor.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~HOW TO PLAY~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

To interact with and navigate the world of the game, you must use a basic set of commands. These allow you to look at and pick up items, walk around, talk to characters and more. 

IMPORTANT: The game supports many unlisted natural language commands (like "play piano" or "drink water"). Feel free to experiment and see what works (sometimes, you will have to!) However, the following list of basic commands includes most of what you need to complete the game. 

!!!!SAY "HELP" TO SEE THESE COMMANDS AGAIN!!!!

***INTERACTIONS WITH ROOMS, OBJECTS, AND CHARACTERS***

"Look around" 
Tells you what's in the current room.

"Inventory"
Tells you what objects you are currently carrying.

"Look at _____" 

"Take/Pick up _____"

"Use _____"

"Use _____ with _____ " 
Combines objects together.

"Open _____" and "Close _____"

"Push _____" and "Pull _____"

***CONVERSATIONS***

"Talk to _____"

"List topics" 
After you've started a conversation with someone, view what topics are available to discuss. (If you get the response "You don't see that there" make sure you're actually in a conversation. "Talk to" the character.)

"Ask about _____" 
After you've started a conversation, ask about specific topics available for that character.

"Goodbye" 
Ends a conversation you're having with a character. 

***BASIC NAVIGATION***

"Go North/South/West/East/Up/Down"
Navigate the game with these basic cardinal directions.

"List exits" 
Tells you what exits are available in the current room/scene.

***FAST TRAVEL***
 
After you've already visited a room, you can fast travel back at any point by simply saying: 
"Go to _____" — (e.g. "Go to the Living Room")

!!!!SAY "HELP" TO SEE THESE COMMANDS AGAIN!!!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PART I: THE NEXUS

**SFX: WHIRLING, ELECTRIC SOUNDS**

A flash of blinding light. The world spins around you in a dizzying array of colors, shapes and sounds. Your stomach twists and lurches as if in free fall. You try to focus... To remember...

**SFX: RESTAURANT SOUNDS**

...A cafe.

BARTENDER: “Evening, Rick. Hell of a storm we’re having. Have a seat and dry off. Lemme guess, the usual?”

**SFX: THUNDER BOLT, DISORIENTING ELECTRIC WHIRLING**

Electric clouds roil around you. You’re falling...falling…

...Focus. 

**SFX: COFFEE MUG CLINKING AGAINST DISH**

Coffee. Chicory coffee. You take a sip. Then she bursts through the door. 

WOMAN: “Help! Please, help!”

You run to her. She’s drenched and shaking.

WOMAN: “He’s coming, you have to take this. Please take it!”

She hands you something...a flat piece of stone.

**SFX: DOOR SLAMMING OPEN**

MAN: "Where is it?! Kindra, you have to—”

WOMAN: “Dar kan a udtenak, dar kan ki’udbah…”

BARTENDER: “Sir, sir! Get away from her!!”

MAN: “Kindra, stop! You don’t know what you’re doing!”

WOMAN: “Dar kan a udtenak, dar kan ki’udbah alliga!”

The stone glows and bursts with light in your hands. You stumble backward. 

MAN: “NO!!”

**SFX: LIGHTNING, WHIRLING SOUNDS. MUSIC AND SFX SWELL TO A CLIMAX. AND THEN…SILENCE.** 

Your eyes blink open as the world around you comes into focus. You are in a small sparsely decorated bedroom with an antique style reminiscent of a time you can't quite place. 

You don't know how you got here... The last thing you remember is... the diner in Jackson Square. The girl, she was in trouble...

You search your memory for more detail, but the strain hurts your head. It is an odd sensation — it's not that you can't remember, but rather your brain just can't be bothered to do it right now. 

You snap out of your reverie and notice the details of the room.
The candlelit bed chamber is small, but cozy.

exits.text: to the west leading back to the hall of history

intro.text: You step onto a wide balcony. Looking out, you see a sky full of clouds tinted an unnatural purple hue. Rising in the distance you see a dim lighthouse, but beyond that you can't see any water on the horizon. In fact, you can't see much of anything. On the ground below the balcony, there is a stone patio beside a grassy lawn.

You step into the hidden passage and make your way down the stairs. As you descend, the light grows dimmer and dimmer — a chill runs up the back of your spine. When you reach the bottom step, you can't see anything.

exits.text: up the curtain to the balcony

intro.text:
You climb down the curtain, scaling the side of the building — your jacket billowing dramatically in the wind. 

The end of the curtain hovers a few feet off a stone patio. You leap down and look around:

The mansion towers imposingly next you. Its domed turrets and elaborately ornamented cornices and balustrades remind you of the Victorian mansions in the garden district back in New Orleans.

sceneList.name: Base of the Lighthouse

exits.text: west along the path to the East Lawn
up to the Lantern Room of the lighthouse

intro.text: You follow the path through a patch of trees and arrive at the base of a lighthouse.
You walk up north behind the mansion.
You walk to the lawn west of the mansion.

sceneList.name: The Lantern Room

exits.text: down to the base of the lighthouse
west out to the exterior catwalk of the tower

intro.text: You swing back the door and head inside the lighthouse. After scaling the tower's long spiral staircase, you arrive inside the lighthouse's lantern room.

exits.text: to the east back to the lantern room

intro.text: You step out onto the metal catwalk that loops around the top of the lighthouse. A crisp breeze kisses your skin and the sky is filled with clouds tinted a strange purple hue.

You fly through the air at breakneck speeds until the cable incline gradually becomes less steep. As you approach the mansion, your velocity slows and you manage to land on the rooftop with surprising grace.

sceneList.name: The Kennel House

intro.text:
You step into the old kennel house. Tumbleweeds of dog hair and piles of miscellaneous detritus pepper every surface. An unshaven mutt of a man shouts drunkenly from the corner:

"Ah! A fresh face! Come in lad, come in! Warm yourself by the fire and join an old kennel master for a drink!" He takes a long pull from a jar of some potent liquid you can smell from across the room. 

"I've gotten so sick of looking at the same goddamn faces. You know the problem with eternity? It never ends!"

exits.text: north further into the hedge maze

play('"Oh, Archie is my fiancé. He gave me this beautiful ring here. But he\'s been missing for such a long time. Days, maybe even weeks. It\'s so hard to keep track of time in this place, but you\'ll find that out if you haven\'t already. I do miss him so. topics.name: This place
The Master

response.text: "Well you must be new here if you haven’t met the Master. He’s a demanding fellow with an impeccable taste for gourmet cooking. He found me some years ago and employed me as his private chef. Little did I know it would bring me here! Or that I would spend countless hours slaving away to cobble together culinary masterpieces from what meagre flora and fauna can be found in this godforsaken place."

topics.name: escape
passcode

response.text: "Yes...hmmm...the passcode. Funny thing. I can't remember it. Whenever the Master wanted me to remember, he had me make the Eggs Benedict. The smell always jogged it back out of me. But then he'd take the recipe back, and I'd forget all over again."

response.text:
**TAPE RECORDER SFX**

KINDRA: "Hey, Kindra, it’s Kindra. Found this old tape recorder tucked away in Father’s study.  Figure maybe it can help with our memory if we start keeping a little voice diary. So, you know, don’t forget to keep up with it, okay? Also, don’t tell father about this. He doesn’t like me messing with temporal artifacts, so it’s our little secret. He’s gone again today. He's been gone for awhile this time. Maybe in Europe again. Hope he comes back soon, the house is really starting to fall apart. In his absence, I’ve taken to walking the grounds. Yesterday I tried to solve the hedge maze, but nothing made any sense to me. I know there’s some trick to it, but it’s hard to run an empirical study when you can barely even remember what you had for breakfast. Tonight I think I’ll go up the lighthouse and watch the stars flickering over the edge of the world. I like looking at them — it’s peaceful. It almost feels like I’m somewhere else. "

help.text:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~HOW TO PLAY~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

To interact with and navigate the world of the game, you must use a basic set of commands. These allow you to look at and pick up items, walk around, talk to characters and more. 

IMPORTANT: The game supports many unlisted natural language commands (like "play piano" or "drink water"). Feel free to experiment and see what works (sometimes, you will have to!) However, the following list of basic commands includes most of what you need to complete the game. 

!!!!SAY "HELP" TO SEE THESE COMMANDS AGAIN!!!!

***INTERACTIONS WITH ROOMS, OBJECTS, AND CHARACTERS***

"Look around" 
Tells you what's in the current room.

"Inventory"
Tells you what objects you are currently carrying.

"Look at _____" 

"Take/Pick up _____"

"Use _____"

"Use _____ with _____ " 
Combines objects together.

"Open _____" and "Close _____"

"Push _____" and "Pull _____"

***CONVERSATIONS***

"Talk to _____"

"List topics" 
After you've started a conversation with someone, view what topics are available to discuss. (If you get the response "You don't see that there" make sure you're actually in a conversation. "Talk to" the character.)

"Ask about _____" 
After you've started a conversation, ask about specific topics available for that character.

"Goodbye" 
Ends conversation you're having with a character. 

***BASIC NAVIGATION***

"Go North/South/West/East/Up/Down"
Navigate the game with these basic cardinal directions.

"List exits" 
Tells you what exits are available in the current room/scene.

***FAST TRAVEL***
 
After you've already visited a room, you can fast travel back at any point by simply saying: 
"Go to _____" — (e.g. "Go to the Living Room")

!!!!SAY "HELP" TO SEE THESE COMMANDS AGAIN!!!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

If you wanted to spend your life moving pills from bottle to bottle, you would have gone to pharmacy school.
While the thermos could use a cleaning, this rag might have better uses.
Better not keep your eggs in one basket...or thermos.
There's no need to mutilate these lovely petunias.
That would make for an extremely poor vase.
You attempt to chop up the sleeping pills, but every time you put any pressure on the blade, the pill rolls away. You'll need some better way to pulverize them.
You've had your fill of playing butcher for the day.
The powder is already as fine as it's going to get.
Just the thought of this blade ruining your beautiful trench coat is sickening to you.
You make a mental note: learn how to whittle.
You might be willing to steal art, but vandalize it? Never.
A punctured gas tank sounds like an explosively bad idea.
It's already greasy enough.

Nothing in the recipe calls for drowsiness...
Swapping the love letter for a breakfast recipe seems more confusing than useful.
There's really not enough grease here for the rag to soak up.
With these eggs, you're one step closer to being able to make some Eggs Benedict.

In a different world, perhaps these two simple machines could have been friends.
